intro: Alonsoa linearis, commonly known as the slender alonsoa, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks. Its flowers are often visited by hummingbirds and other pollinators due to their bright colors and nectar-rich structure. Alonsoa linearis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
